physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man standing up. He is looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. He is wearing a long sleeved shirt and pants. His right hand is placed on top of a table.
sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows John Mather standing before a painted backdrop. The shopmark ‘Tien Seng. Photographer, Singapore’ is printed on the lower edge of the carte. 

Tien Seng was a photography studio located at North Bridge Road in Singapore. Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
subject_terms_1: black-and-white photographs studio portraits men (male humans)
